page.title: 06POWER STATION
page.content:
WEST BURTON Power Station.
West Burton Power Station was built in 1965. It was built there because it uses 12 million gallons of water per day and the river Trent run where it is built. It is called West Burton because where it is built there used to be a little village called West Burton.The cooling towers are 350 feet high 284 feet in perimeter at the bottom and 164 feet in perimeter at the top.In 24 hours there are 3 shifts altogether.The fuel they use is coal but in a crisis like the miners strike they use oil.700 people are employed there.
